tweet: These states get it. The Trump Administration proposal to roll back clean car standards will hurt consumers, families and communities, no matter what state they‚Äôre in. https://twitter.com/StateImpactCntr/status/1144709366572093440¬†‚Ä¶

New York's Capital Region is a leader in U.S. scientific communities. We fought to secure funding for @NSF, which drives U.S. research in advanced manufacturing, cybersecurity, neuroscience & STEM. Important for driving innovation & economic competition here & throughout America!

Capital Region museums & historic sites are important centers of learning, culture and offer a rich sense of place. We strengthened Museum Services & Historic Preservation Offices including preservation grants for civil rights sites & Historically Black Colleges & Universities.

Unnecessary wars take American lives and cost us trillions. Through the funding process we moved to repeal the 2001 Authorization for the Use of Military Force, preventing the President from taking unsanctioned military action in Iran and elsewhere without Congressional approval.

Mental health is healthcare, full stop. Failing to recognize that has allowed suicide rates to rise. My colleagues and I fought to strengthen suicide prevention programs, a valuable resource for Capital Region families and communities working to address this challenge.

Many households in our Capital Region lack broadband internet access, blocking opportunity & holding our economy back. Earlier this year the House passed my ACCESS BROADBAND Act to improve  broadband resources. This time we made progress funding corrections to U.S. broadband maps

Continuing our push toward building a just and thriving clean energy economy, we were able to secure meaningful funding for America's Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP) and Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP). Both are programs that save lives & save $$$!

The Trump Admin proposed heavy cuts to America‚Äôs clean energy research programs as part of their efforts to roll back our climate progress. We fought to secure vital funding for these crucial programs instead & to block U.S. withdrawal from the voluntary Paris Climate Agreement.

Our Erie Canalway is a treasure of New York heritage and a major source of jobs, tourism & delight for many. We raised the funding cap to ensure this locally-managed heritage system will continue to thrive, entertain & tell our region's important stories for years to come. pic.twitter.com/xeYcXT0Bac

The #opioidcrisis has taken the lives of too many friends and loved ones in our Capital Region. Despite heavy cuts proposed by President Trump, we funded substance use treatment and prevention programs AND development of addiction treatment curriculum in medical & nursing schools

Our House majority advanced the 10th of 12 funding bills this week to avoid a gov't shutdown in FY 2020. These debates are an important time for us to fight for the priorities of our constituents & our nation. My team and I had a lot of wins for the people of #NY20

1/ pic.twitter.com/03pAwSlWEW
Because these 2 basic, common-sense protections were not included in the Senate border funding bill, I voted NO.
Our legislation would have also ensured that Members of Congress can exercise our Constitutional oversight function and visit these detention facilities in person without prior approval. 5/

Earlier this week, my colleagues and I passed a bill through the House by a wide margin that would have put meaningful guardrails in place to ensure children and families have the health care, water, nutrition, hygiene, and sanitation needs they require. 4/
After years of this Administration‚Äôs deception and broken trust, Congress simply cannot write another blank check that would allow these abuses to continue. 3/

No child should die while under the care of the United States of America. 

This should not need to be said.
For months, this Administration has ripped children from the arms of their parents, denied them essential care, soap, beds and medicine in our custody and forced them to sleep on crowded floors. 1/
It‚Äôs now up to the Senate, and Majority Leader McConnell, to act swiftly and pass the House version to deal with the crisis at the Southern border. 5/
This legislation also requires that the Administration spend previously Congressionally-appropriated funds to promote stability in Guatemala, Honduras, and El Salvador. 4/
We also put in place provisions to ensure children have shampoo when they shower, fresh diapers for babies that have been in the same ones for 3 weeks straight and basic sanitary conditions. 3/
Our bill delivers humanitarian resources to border facilities on condition that members of Congress can show up at these facilities unannounced and ensure accountability for what we find. 2/

My colleagues and I advanced $4.5 billion in border funding this week to confront the painful, manufactured crisis at our Southern border.

That is why I am so grateful for today‚Äôs hearing and I for one will continue to listen closely for opportunities and actions we can take to more fully realize America‚Äôs potential in #science. https://science.house.gov/hearings/combating-sexual-harassment-in-science¬†‚Ä¶

...we will lose these very same young woman whom we have worked so hard to inspire to go into STEM. And we will lose every extraordinary thing they would have achieved because we failed to address the problem before us today.

I have supported many pieces of legislation to diversify the #STEM workforce and inspire young women to go into the STEM fields. However, if the STEM fields are not a welcome place for women and this culture of sexual harassment is allowed to continue...

As an engineer I want to thank @SWEtalk for their work highlighting this issue & reminding us that we lose a golden opportunity when women who want to go into engineering are thrown into a culture where sexual harassment is tolerated and they are undermined. This is unacceptable.

We must act decisively on this issue to end the outdated and useless culture that allows for harassment and discrimination in science. There is no reason to perpetuate a perverse dynamic that can only serve to limit our perspectives and our ability to solve problems.

A nation's greatness has often been measured by its achievements in science. If half of us are held back, we squander the potential of those who would have gone on to find lifesaving cures, make discoveries that enhance our lives or change our understanding of the universe.

Every time a woman in America is driven out of the sciences, it diminishes our nation‚Äôs leadership & competitiveness. When sexual harassment in the fields of science, technology, engineering or math is accepted or ignored, we lose future leaders, inventors, innovators & pioneers.

Thank you Chairwoman Johnson @RepEBJ for holding today's @HouseScience hearing on Combating Sexual Harassment in Science and for your enduring leadership and dedication to this critical issue. Thank you to all of our witnesses for helping shine a light on this pervasive problem. pic.twitter.com/ta8JXHUSwj

While I believe Congress must perform our Constitutional duty to hold the President accountable, this effort must not and will not distract us from our other vital work improving healthcare protections for all Americans, confronting the growing climate crisis... 8/

...and open an impeachment inquiry to more fully assess the Constitutional implications of seemingly criminal actions by the President and his campaign, and to determine whether formal impeachment charges need to be filed. 7/

After careful review of the evidence and testimony currently available, and in service to my oath, it is my judgment that Congress needs to accept the baton being handed to us by now former Special Counsel Mueller... 6/

The integrity of our elections & equality before the law have long stood as cornerstones of American free society. On taking office, I swore an oath to uphold our Constitution and put duty to the United States & the American people before any matters of political convenience. 5/

Mr. Mueller went so far as to say that ‚Äúthe Constitution requires a process other than the criminal justice system to formally accuse a sitting president of wrongdoing.‚Äù This comment can only be understood to mean that this Constitutional responsibility rests with Congress. 4/
Mueller also made clear that this determination was not a result of any legal assessment by himself or his office of the underlying crimes his team uncovered. 3/

Mueller‚Äôs statement made clear that he felt, no matter the findings of his investigation, that he could not pursue criminal charges against the President due to an official Department of Justice policy. 2/

After months spent allowing the President and Attorney General to mislead the American people, Special Counsel Mueller finally set the record straight last week regarding his investigation of Russian interference into the 2016 election.
